policyDn.description: The Distinguished Name (DN) of the policy folder
policyDn.title: Policy DN

Subject.description: The Common Name field for the certificate Subject (DN)
Subject.title: Subject

SetWorkToDo.description: The setting to control certificate processing
SetWorkToDo.title: Set Work To Do

Approvers.description: An array of one or more identities for certificate workflow approvers
Approvers.title: Approvers

Organization.description: The Organization field for the certificate Subject DN. Specify a value when the CSR centrally generates.
Organization.title: Organization

OrganizationalUnit.description: The department or division within the organization that is responsible for maintaining the certificate
OrganizationalUnit.title: Organizational Unit

CertificateType.description: One of the following Certificate objects. Ignores any other value.
CertificateType.title: Certificate Type

Contacts.description: An array of one or more identities for users or groups who receive notifications about events pertaining to the object
Contacts.title: Contacts

name.description: The SAN friendly name that corresponds to the Type or TypeName parameter. For example, if a TypeName is IPAddress, the Name value is a valid IP address.
name.title: Name

Typename.description: An integer that represents the kind of SAN
Typename.title: Typename

City.description: The City field for the certificate Subject DN. Specify a value when requesting a centrally generated CSR.
City.title: City

CADN.description: Only required when no policy sets a CA template. The Distinguished Name (DN) of the Trust Protection Platform Certificate Authority Template object for enrolling the certificate.
CADN.title: CADN

State.description: The State field for the certificate Subject DN. Specify a value when requesting a centrally generated CSR.
State.title: State

DisableAutomaticRenewal.description: The setting to control whether manual intervention is required for certificate renewal
DisableAutomaticRenewal.title: Disable Automatic Renewal

KeyAlgorithm.description: The encryption algorithm for the public ke:
KeyAlgorithm.title: Key Algorithm

EllipticCurve.description: For Elliptic Curve Cryptography (ECC), use this parameter in conjunction with KeyAlgorithm
EllipticCurve.title: Elliptic Curve

CreatedBy.description: The person, entity, or caller of this request. The default is Web SDK. Avoid overriding the default unless the caller is a significant enterprise application that is tightly integrated with Trust Protection Platform, such as a custom web portal. To add details, use Origin instead. If you want both attributes to have the same value, set only CreatedBy.
CreatedBy.title: Created By

origin.description: Additional information, such as the name and version of the calling application, that describes the source of this enrollment, renewal, or provisioning request. The default is Web SDK.
origin.title: Origin

PKCS10.description: The PKCS#10 Certificate Signing Request (CSR). Omit escape characters such as or . If this value is provided, any Subject DN fields and the KeyBitSize in the request are ignored.
PKCS10.title: PKCS10

KeyBitSize.description: Use this parameter when KeyAlgorithm is RSA. The number of bits to allow for key generation.
KeyBitSize.title: Key Bit Size

host.description: The physical Fully Qualified Domain Name (FQDN) for the host or the IP address for a device
host.title: Host

applications.description: An array of one or more Application objects to allow software, which runs on ObjectName, to use the same certificate
applications.title: Applications

TrustedFingerprint.description: For Secure Shell (SSH) keys. The SSH server key fingerprint. If this value is set, and EnforceKnownHost is enabled, Trust Protection Platform will only successfully connect to the device if the hosts fingerprint matches this value.
TrustedFingerprint.title: Trusted Fingerprint

SudoCredentialDN.description: Use in conjunction with UseSudo. The DN that holds the password credential to be used if sudo is configured to prompt for a password when executing a command.
SudoCredentialDN.title: Sudo Credential DN

CreatedBy.description: The person or entity that is creating the device and any associated software applications for the device. Any value is accepted. Default is Web SDK.
CreatedBy.title: Created By

ObjectName.description: The device host name or IP address for the certificate object in Trust Protection Platform. If the value is missing, the object name is the Subject.
ObjectName.title: Object Name

EnforceKnownHost.description: For SSH keys. true: Enable known host key enforcement. false: Disable known host key enforcement.
EnforceKnownHost.title: Enforce Known Host

UseSudo.description: Use in conjunction with SudoCredentialDN. For cases where the device credentials require sudo privilege elevation to execute commands when installing the certificate on a Unix or Linux device: true: Execute commands using sudo when provisioning. false: Execute commands directly without using sudo.
UseSudo.title: Use Sudo

CloudService.description: Required for Amazon EC2 provisioning. AWS: An Amazon E2C cloud service. Requires you to install and configure the Cloud Instance Monitoring feature.
CloudService.title: Cloud Service

ConcurrentConnectionLimit.description: Maximum number of connections the device will accept from Trust Protection Platform
ConcurrentConnectionLimit.title: Concurrent Connection Limit

Contacts.description: An array of one or more identities who receive notifications for this device
Contacts.title: Contacts

CloudRegion.description: Required for Amazon EC2 provisioning. The geographic location where the cloud service instance resides. An instance in AWS can only exist in a single region.
CloudRegion.title: Cloud Region

port.description: The port number to communicate with the device
port.title: Port

TempDirectory.description: The host directory path to hold temporary files during provisioning. For example /tmp/. The folder should have the necessary write permissions.
TempDirectory.title: Temp Directory

CloudInstanceID.description: Required for Amazon EC2 provisioning. The unique cloud instance ID.
CloudInstanceID.title: Cloud Instance ID

ManagementType.description: The level of management that Trust Protection Platform applies to the certificate
ManagementType.title: Management Type

Reenable.description: The action to control a previously disabled certificate
Reenable.title: Reenable

Country.description: The Country field for the certificate Subject DN. Specify a value when requesting a centrally generated CSR.
Country.title: Country

Reenable.description: The action to control a previously disabled certificate
Reenable.title: Reenable

PKCS10.description: The PKCS#10 Certificate Signing Request (CSR). Omit escape characters such as or . If this value is provided, any Subject DN fields and the KeyBitSize in the request are ignored.
PKCS10.title: PKCS10

PKCS10.description: The PKCS#10 policy Signing Request (CSR). Omit escape characters such as or . If this value is provided, any Subject DN fields and the KeyBitSize in the request are ignored.
PKCS10.title: PKCS10

returnAll.description: Whether to return all results or only up to a given limit
returnAll.title: Return All

limit.description: Max number of results to return
limit.title: Limit

binaryProperty.description: The name of the input field containing the binary file data to be uploaded
binaryProperty.title: Input Data Field Name

certificateDN.description: The Distinguished Name (DN) of the certificate to renew
certificateDN.title: Certificate DN

PolicyDN.description: The folder DN for the new certificate. If the value is missing, the folder name is the system default. If no system default is configured
PolicyDN.title: Policy DN

certificateId.description: A GUID that uniquely identifies the certificate
certificateId.title: Certificate GUID

init_kwargs.title: Scade tools: Venafi TLS Protect Datacenter
